## Learning Objectives

* Be able to classify variables as either numerical or categorical.
* Identify and distinguish explanatory (predictor) and response variables.
* Identify and distinguish observational and experimental studies.
* Describe the benefits and drawbacks of common study designs.
* Describe the relationship between a sample and a population.

## Lecture on data collection, observational studies, and experiments - with practice problems (8:00 - 9:15 AM)

For practice problems, you can work individually or in groups. We'll go through the problems as a class. No work is collected during this section.


## Chimowitz et al. 2011 assignment (9:00 AM to 10:00 AM)

In groups, work on the Chimowitz assignment. **Each individual submits** their assignment by the end of the class period.
